map.name: deep_resserach_to_website
map.description: End-to-end workflow: classify → scope → hypothesize → deep research (GoT) → verify → generate website → verify → deploy.

nodes.label: Artifacts & Folder Structure
nodes.short_def: The files and folders the workflow expects and produces.
nodes.why_important: Makes work auditable and enables deterministic handoff from research → website → deployment.
nodes.deep_dive: Key artifacts include the input YAML, `/RESEARCH` outputs (including evidence ledger), and `/website` build output.
nodes.example: Keep persona images in `/RESEARCH/images/` and copy into `/website/assets/images/` as needed.

nodes.label: Classification Prompt
nodes.short_def: Copy-paste prompt for classifying the request.
nodes.why_important: Standardizes how complexity is evaluated.
nodes.deep_dive: Includes service count, locations, market complexity, relationship, and stakes.
nodes.example: Answer the 5 evaluation questions, then choose A/B/C/D with reasoning.
nodes.eli5: A checklist to label the job.

nodes.label: Data Accuracy & Navigation Review
nodes.short_def: Validate content matches research and all links work.
nodes.why_important: Incorrect or broken pages undermine credibility.
nodes.deep_dive: Verify persona/competitive/funnel data, and ensure consistent nav/footer across pages.
nodes.example: Check active nav indicator and that every page is reachable.
nodes.eli5: Make sure it’s correct and clickable.

nodes.label: Deep Research → Website
nodes.short_def: System for turning a research request into a deployed, research-backed website.
nodes.why_important: Creates a repeatable, verifiable pipeline from ambiguity to a live site with strong UX, accurate claims, and clear artifacts.
nodes.deep_dive:
Trunk phases (0→6): Complexity classification → Information gathering → Research intensity → Hypothesis formation → Deep research (GoT) → Research review → Website generation → Website verification → Deployment.
Source-of-truth workflow docs are vendored in `reference/template_deep_reserach/`.
nodes.example: Use `reference/template_deep_reserach/New_question_dynamic.md` to scope inputs, then follow the phase workflow to produce `/RESEARCH` + `/website` artifacts.
nodes.eli5: Figure out what to learn, double-check it, then build a website from it and put it live.

nodes.label: Design Compliance Review
nodes.short_def: Page-by-page check against the design system.
nodes.why_important: Prevents UI drift and “almost finished” deliverables.
nodes.deep_dive: Confirm aurora background, glassmorphism, typography, no pure black/white, and Lucide icons only.
nodes.example: Replace every emoji with a Lucide SVG.
nodes.eli5: Make it match the design rules.

nodes.label: Design System (Ethereal Clarity)
nodes.short_def: Glass cards + aurora background + premium typography + Lucide icons (no emojis).
nodes.why_important: Ensures a consistent, high-quality aesthetic across all pages.
nodes.deep_dive: Source: `reference/template_deep_reserach/deisgn_elements.txt` (note filename spelling).
nodes.example: Use Playfair Display for headings and Inter for body; use Lucide SVG icons with thin stroke.

nodes.label: Evidence Ledger & Claim Confidence
nodes.short_def: Track claims, sources, independence groups, and confidence (C1/C2/C3).
nodes.why_important: Enables audits and prevents weakly-supported claims from leaking into outputs.
nodes.deep_dive: Maintain a ledger with citations and independence grouping; score and verify claims before synthesis.
nodes.example: Mark a claim as C3 only with multiple independent, high-authority sources.
nodes.eli5: A spreadsheet of what you think is true and why.

nodes.label: Fix-Until-PASS Loop
nodes.short_def: Iterate until the research review gate passes.
nodes.why_important: Ensures the system doesn’t advance with known errors.
nodes.deep_dive: If context limits or blockers happen, summarize state to file and continue or declare BLOCKED.
nodes.example: When a claim fails verification, downgrade confidence or find better sources and update the ledger.

nodes.label: GitHub Repo + Push
nodes.short_def: Create repo, commit artifacts, and push history.
nodes.why_important: Enables collaboration, review, and traceability for deployment.
nodes.deep_dive: Repo should include the website output and any required build/verification scripts.
nodes.example: Commit with clear messages per phase or per deliverable set.

nodes.label: GoT Controller
nodes.short_def: Graph of Thoughts controller: nodes/edges, scoring, pruning, and traversal.
nodes.why_important: Coordinates parallel research paths and filters low-quality sources and claims.
nodes.deep_dive: Includes Generate/Aggregate/Refine/RedTeam transformations and a budget-based stop condition.
nodes.example: Prune candidates below a threshold score and keep best-per-depth.
nodes.eli5: A system for managing lots of research threads.

nodes.label: Hypothesis Templates
nodes.short_def: Templates for market, competitive, and growth hypotheses (H-M/H-C/H-G).
nodes.why_important: Keeps hypotheses testable and structured.
nodes.deep_dive: Include confirming + disconfirming evidence requirements and test queries.
nodes.example: Write 2–3 hypotheses per category with a 0.xx prior probability.

nodes.label: Input Variables (YAML)
nodes.short_def: Standardized YAML inputs for the research request.
nodes.why_important: Inputs drive folder structure, agent allocation, and website data binding.
nodes.deep_dive: Defined in `reference/template_deep_reserach/New_question_dynamic.md` between the INPUT VARIABLES markers.
nodes.example: Include `company.website` and service names so logo extraction and page generation can proceed.
nodes.eli5: The details you provide up front.

nodes.label: Intensity Tiers
nodes.short_def: Express/Standard/Comprehensive/Enterprise tier definitions.
nodes.why_important: Determines how much research and verification to do.
nodes.deep_dive: Tiering considers service count, location count, market complexity, and client value.
nodes.example: Use Enterprise tier for strategic, high-stakes decisions.

nodes.label: Logo Extraction
nodes.short_def: Extract and store the company logo for research and website use.
nodes.why_important: The logo is required for a coherent website header/footer and branding.
nodes.deep_dive: Save to `/RESEARCH/images/[COMPANY_SHORTNAME]_logo.png` and copy to the website assets folder.
nodes.example: Prefer SVG or transparent PNG when available.

nodes.label: Performance Optimization (Core Web Vitals)
nodes.short_def: Meet LCP/FID/CLS targets and keep page weight low.
nodes.why_important: Fast pages improve UX and credibility; avoid regressions with CLS-safe images and deferred assets.
nodes.deep_dive: Targets: LCP < 2.5s, FID < 100ms, CLS < 0.1, total weight < 1.5MB.
nodes.example: Include width/height on all images; lazy-load below-fold images; defer non-critical JS.

nodes.label: Phase 0 — Complexity Classification
nodes.short_def: Classify the request (A/B/C/D) to route effort and tooling.
nodes.why_important: Prevents over-engineering simple lookups and under-resourcing high-stakes investigations.
nodes.deep_dive: Types: A (Lookup), B (Synthesis), C (Analysis), D (Investigation).
nodes.example: Type A: one authoritative source; Type D: novel/high-stakes, requires red team and deeper verification.
nodes.eli5: Decide how big the job is before starting.

nodes.label: Phase 1 — Information Gathering
nodes.short_def: Collect required inputs and update the request template.
nodes.why_important: Bad inputs cascade into bad research and broken websites; gather and confirm early.
nodes.deep_dive: Includes business name, shortname, website URL, addresses, services, and research focus.
nodes.example: If hours/timezone are unclear, ask explicitly and record the assumption.

nodes.label: Phase 1.1 — Research Intensity
nodes.short_def: Pick intensity tier (Express/Standard/Comprehensive/Enterprise).
nodes.why_important: Sets time budget, number of agents, and verification depth.
nodes.deep_dive: Tier choice should reflect service count, location count, market complexity, and stakes.
nodes.example: Enterprise tier uses more searches, deeper verification, and stronger evidence requirements.

nodes.label: Phase 1.5 — Hypothesis Formation
nodes.short_def: Draft testable market/competitive/growth hypotheses with priors.
nodes.why_important: Keeps research focused and makes verification measurable.
nodes.deep_dive: Hypotheses should have confirming/disconfirming evidence and test queries.
nodes.example: Create 6–9 hypotheses with 0.xx priors and track status in PROGRESS.

nodes.label: Phase 2 — Deep Research (GoT)
nodes.short_def: Run Graph of Thoughts research with evidence ledger and red teaming.
nodes.why_important: Produces higher-quality synthesis by exploring multiple paths and filtering weak sources.
nodes.deep_dive: Use GoT nodes/edges, scoring, pruning, and an evidence ledger with independence groups.
nodes.example: Generate → Aggregate → Refine → RedTeam loops until budget or saturation stop condition.
nodes.eli5: Research widely, then narrow to what’s true.

nodes.label: Phase 3 — Research Review
nodes.short_def: Verify claims, citations, and reasoning; fix until PASS.
nodes.why_important: Prevents incorrect claims from reaching the website and deployment.
nodes.deep_dive: Run checklists, validate sources, and resolve contradictions before moving forward.
nodes.example: If verification fails, patch the research outputs and rerun the checklist.

nodes.label: Phase 4 — Website Generation
nodes.short_def: Bind research outputs into the website structure and design system.
nodes.why_important: Turns research into a readable deliverable with consistent IA and premium UX.
nodes.deep_dive: Use the website map template, enforce Ethereal Clarity styling, and replace emojis with Lucide icons.
nodes.example: Create the full page set and ensure navigation is consistent across pages.
nodes.eli5: Build the site from the research.

nodes.label: Phase 5 — Website Verification
nodes.short_def: Review each page for design compliance, data accuracy, navigation, and performance.
nodes.why_important: Catches broken links, missing assets, inconsistent styling, and performance regressions before deploy.
nodes.deep_dive: Includes page-by-page checks, Core Web Vitals targets, and asset sizing rules.
nodes.example: Verify no emojis remain; ensure all images have width/height attributes to avoid CLS.
nodes.eli5: Make sure the site is correct and fast.

nodes.label: Phase 6 — Deployment
nodes.short_def: Push to GitHub and deploy to Vercel; verify live.
nodes.why_important: Completes the workflow with a shareable, live URL and auditable history.
nodes.deep_dive: If blocked externally, create BLOCKERS.md with exact error + next step.
nodes.example: Deploy to Vercel, then check all pages load and assets resolve on the live domain.

nodes.label: Priors, Tests, and Tracking
nodes.short_def: How to assign priors and track hypothesis status through research.
nodes.why_important: Prevents “hand-wavy” conclusions and forces explicit uncertainty management.
nodes.deep_dive: Track status in PROGRESS with links to evidence ledger entries.
nodes.example: Mark hypotheses as Confirmed, Disconfirmed, or Inconclusive with citations.

nodes.label: Red Team + Domain Overlays
nodes.short_def: Negative searches and domain-specific constraints for regulated topics.
nodes.why_important: Finds counterevidence and enforces safer claims in regulated domains.
nodes.deep_dive: Use `reference/template_deep_reserach/DOMAIN_OVERLAYS/` for domain-specific sources and “when in doubt” guidance.
nodes.example: Healthcare overlay should bias toward PubMed/CDC/state boards over blogs.
nodes.eli5: Try to prove yourself wrong, with domain rules.

nodes.label: Reference Materials
nodes.short_def: Vendored source docs that define the workflow and templates.
nodes.why_important: Keeps the concept grounded in the actual process docs and prevents drift.
nodes.deep_dive: See `reference/template_deep_reserach/` for the full spec, prompts, and overlays.
nodes.example: Open `reference/template_deep_reserach/Claude.md` for the complete phase-by-phase workflow.

nodes.label: Required Questions
nodes.short_def: The minimum questions to ask before starting research.
nodes.why_important: Ensures the research and website are scoped correctly.
nodes.deep_dive: Includes company name, short name, website, addresses, services, and research focus.
nodes.example: If multiple locations exist, record all addresses as a YAML list.
nodes.eli5: What you need to ask first.

nodes.label: Research Output Folder (/RESEARCH)
nodes.short_def: Research artifacts: summaries, raw notes, evidence ledger, and images.
nodes.why_important: Preserves traceability from claims to sources and supports downstream website generation.
nodes.deep_dive: Includes an evidence ledger (claims + sources) and generated persona images under `/RESEARCH/images/`.
nodes.example: Save the company logo to `/RESEARCH/images/[COMPANY_SHORTNAME]_logo.png`.

nodes.label: Research Request Template (New_question_dynamic.md)
nodes.short_def: YAML input template + dynamic folder contract for research.
nodes.why_important: Standardizes inputs (company/services/market) so research agents and website generation stay consistent.
nodes.deep_dive: Source: `reference/template_deep_reserach/New_question_dynamic.md`.
nodes.example: Fill in `company.name`, `company.website`, and `services.primary.name` before starting research.
nodes.eli5: The form you fill out to start.

nodes.label: Research-to-Website Data Binding
nodes.short_def: Rules for mapping research artifacts into website content.
nodes.why_important: Prevents stale or mismatched data and supports traceability.
nodes.deep_dive: Use a content map (e.g., content_map.json) so every page section points back to a research source file.
nodes.example: If a persona card exists on the site, it must map to a persona definition in the research outputs.
nodes.eli5: Connect the research to the site content.

nodes.label: Skill Allocation Plan
nodes.short_def: Which tools/skills to use per phase (research, verification, images, deployment).
nodes.why_important: Ensures the right tool is used for the job and verification is independent.
nodes.deep_dive: Primary patterns: Perplexity for research, Codex for verification, Nanobanana for images, Vercel for deploy.
nodes.example: Use Codex at Phase 3/5 for audit-style verification before proceeding.
nodes.eli5: Use the right tool at the right time.

nodes.label: Type Routing (A/B/C/D)
nodes.short_def: Routing logic for which phases to execute by request type.
nodes.why_important: Aligns effort to complexity and stakes.
nodes.deep_dive: Defined in `reference/template_deep_reserach/Claude.md` under Phase 0.
nodes.example: Type A may skip most phases; Type C/D runs full 0–6 workflow.

nodes.label: Vercel Deploy + Live Verification
nodes.short_def: Deploy and confirm the live site works end-to-end.
nodes.why_important: Ensures the deliverable is actually reachable and correct in production.
nodes.deep_dive: Verify all pages load, assets resolve, and performance is acceptable on the live URL.
nodes.example: If deployment fails, create BLOCKERS.md with the exact error and next steps.

nodes.label: Verification Checklist
nodes.short_def: Checklist for research correctness before website generation.
nodes.why_important: Prevents compounding errors downstream.
nodes.deep_dive: Validate citations, resolve contradictions, and ensure deliverables exist before moving to Phase 4.
nodes.example: If any checklist item fails, update research artifacts and re-run the review.
nodes.eli5: A list of checks before you continue.

nodes.label: Website Creation Prompt
nodes.short_def: Instructions for generating the website from research artifacts.
nodes.why_important: Prevents mismatches between research outputs and website pages, and enforces consistent UI rules.
nodes.deep_dive: Source: `reference/template_deep_reserach/prompt for website.md`.
nodes.example: Use `website_map_master_template_old.md` for page structure and `deisgn_elements.txt` for Ethereal Clarity design.
nodes.eli5: How to build the site from the research.

nodes.label: Website Map & Pages
nodes.short_def: Information architecture and page list for the generated website.
nodes.why_important: Keeps content organized and navigable across the deliverable.
nodes.deep_dive: Source: `reference/template_deep_reserach/website_map_master_template_old.md`.
nodes.example: Typical pages: Home, Executive Summary, Personas, Competitive, Funnels, Marketing, Partnerships.
nodes.eli5: What pages to build and what goes on them.

nodes.label: Website Output Folder (/website)
nodes.short_def: Static website generated from research outputs and templates.
nodes.why_important: Turns synthesized research into a clear, navigable deliverable that can be deployed.
nodes.deep_dive: Website pages follow the template map and embed research outputs (personas, competitive analysis, funnels, marketing, partnerships).
nodes.example: Copy persona headshots from `/RESEARCH/images/` into `/website/assets/images/personas/`.

nodes.label: Workflow Spec (Claude.md)
nodes.short_def: End-to-end phase workflow: classification → research → website → deploy.
nodes.why_important: Defines the phases, gates, and stop rules for the system.
nodes.deep_dive: Source: `reference/template_deep_reserach/Claude.md`.
nodes.example: Follow the trunk phases 0–6 and do not stop until COMPLETE or BLOCKED.
